page.title: 13SATURDAY MARKET IN HERNE BAY
page.content: One branch of the Herne Bay retail trade which does flourish is the Saturday morning market. Traders come from all round the area and from as far as London and they pay a fee to have a market stall. The same traders can usually be found in the same place every week and a wide range of products, from cakes to keys, is sold. The market has its own atmosphere, crowded with people so it is often difficult to move about, while many of the traders call out to draw attention to their bargains. At the market entrances people collect money for good causes and some unofficial traders try to sell from suitcases. Certainly products can be bought cheaply in the market, but sometimes we wonder where the goods have come from.
